text: We will ensure that every family has a pucca house with water connection, toilet, electricity and LPG connection by 2022.
summary: Pucca house with basic amenities for every family by 2022
statusReason: PMAY-G achieved 2.95 crore houses by 2024 against 2.95 crore target, but universal coverage not achieved. Jal Jeevan Mission reached 77% rural households with tap connections by Feb 2024.

text: We are committed to making India a 5 trillion dollar economy by 2024.
summary: $5 trillion economy by 2024
statusReason: India's GDP was approximately $3.5 trillion in 2024. The target was later revised to 2027-28.

text: We will invest Rs. 100 lakh crore in infrastructure over the next 5 years.
summary: Rs. 100 lakh crore infrastructure investment in 5 years
statusReason: National Infrastructure Pipeline launched with Rs. 111 lakh crore investment plan. Capital expenditure increased from Rs. 3.4 lakh crore (2019-20) to Rs. 10 lakh crore (2023-24).

text: We will double the income of farmers by 2022.
summary: Double farmer income by 2022
statusReason: Government committee report showed farmer income grew 59% in nominal terms between 2015-16 and 2022-23, falling short of doubling. Real income growth was lower due to inflation.

evidence.title: Situation Assessment Survey of Agricultural Households

text: We will ensure that no Indian will be left out of development because he/she does not have an Aadhaar Card, Ration Card, Birth Certificate or any other document.
summary: Ensure no citizen excluded from schemes due to lack of documents
statusReason: Aadhaar coverage reached 99% of adult population. However, exclusion errors due to biometric failures and document issues continue to be reported in welfare schemes.

text: We reiterate our position since the time of the Jan Sangh to the abrogation of Article 370.
summary: Abrogate Article 370 (special status for J&K)
statusReason: Article 370 was abrogated on August 5, 2019. Jammu & Kashmir was reorganized into two Union Territories. Supreme Court upheld the decision in December 2023.

evidence.title: The Constitution (Application to Jammu and Kashmir) Order, 2019

text: We will expedite the construction of Ram Temple in Ayodhya.
summary: Expedite Ram Temple construction in Ayodhya
statusReason: Supreme Court verdict in November 2019 allowed temple construction. Ram Mandir inaugurated on January 22, 2024 with Pran Pratishtha ceremony.

text: We will implement the Citizenship Amendment Bill to provide citizenship to Hindus, Jains, Buddhists, Sikhs, Parsis and Christians who came to India due to persecution in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan.
summary: Pass Citizenship Amendment Bill for persecuted minorities
statusReason: Citizenship Amendment Act passed in December 2019. Rules notified in March 2024 to begin implementation. Remains controversial with protests and legal challenges.

text: We will extend the coverage of Ayushman Bharat to cover all eligible under the antyodaya and BPL categories.
summary: Expand Ayushman Bharat health insurance coverage
statusReason: Ayushman Bharat PM-JAY expanded to cover 55+ crore beneficiaries. Over 6.2 crore hospital admissions authorized by 2024. Extended to all 70+ year olds regardless of income in 2024.

evidence.title: Ayushman Bharat Extension for Senior Citizens

text: We will ensure that every willing household gets LPG connection under Ujjwala Yojana by 2022.
summary: LPG connection to all willing households via Ujjwala by 2022
statusReason: Ujjwala Yojana 2.0 launched. Over 10.35 crore LPG connections provided by 2024. Target of 8 crore connections exceeded. Second refill subsidy scheme added.

text: We will implement One Nation One Ration Card to enable access to PDS anywhere in the country.
summary: One Nation One Ration Card for portable PDS access
statusReason: One Nation One Ration Card fully operational across all states and UTs since August 2023. Over 110 crore portability transactions recorded enabling migrant workers to access rations anywhere.

text: We will complete the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project and extend the high-speed rail network to other parts of the country.
summary: Complete Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train, extend high-speed rail
statusReason: Mumbai-Ahmedabad High Speed Rail project ongoing with revised deadline of 2028. Land acquisition 98% complete. Civil works on 350+ km. No other high-speed corridors started.

evidence.title: CAG Audit of Bullet Train Project

text: We will establish a National Traders Welfare Board and create a National Policy for Retail Trade.
summary: National Traders Welfare Board and retail trade policy
statusReason: National Retail Trade Policy drafted but not finalized. PM SVANidhi scheme launched for street vendors. No formal National Traders Welfare Board established at central level.

text: We will complete the Dedicated Freight Corridors and start work on high-speed freight corridors.
summary: Complete Dedicated Freight Corridors
statusReason: Eastern DFC fully operational (2022). Western DFC 95% complete as of 2024. Total 2,843 km built. High-speed freight corridors not yet started.

text: We are committed to implement the Uniform Civil Code.
summary: Implement Uniform Civil Code
statusReason: Law Commission invited public views in 2023. Uttarakhand passed UCC in 2024, first state to do so. No national UCC bill introduced in Parliament yet.

text: We will make India free from open defecation sustainably and ensure every household has access to toilet.
summary: Open defecation free India with toilet access for all
statusReason: India declared ODF in October 2019. Swachh Bharat Mission built 11+ crore toilets. However, surveys show continued open defecation in some areas and issues with toilet usage sustainability.

text: We will ensure Ease of Living through Ease of Doing Business by cutting red tape, simplifying processes and making governance transparent.
summary: Improve Ease of Doing Business rankings
statusReason: India rose to 63rd in World Bank Ease of Doing Business 2020 (from 142nd in 2014). However, World Bank discontinued the report after data manipulation concerns. New B-READY framework shows mixed results.

text: We will bring reforms in education sector and make it globally competitive. Implementation of New Education Policy will be ensured.
summary: Implement New Education Policy
statusReason: National Education Policy 2020 approved. Major reforms include 5+3+3+4 structure, mother tongue instruction, multidisciplinary education. Implementation ongoing across states.

text: We will work towards creation of 10 crore jobs in MSME sector in the next five years.
summary: Create 10 crore jobs in MSME sector in 5 years
statusReason: No comprehensive official data on MSME job creation. COVID-19 pandemic severely impacted MSMEs. PLFS shows overall employment recovery but MSME-specific job creation data unavailable.

text: We will ensure that 75 new medical colleges are set up, especially in underserved districts, and MBBS seats are increased by 10,000 every year.
summary: Set up 75 new medical colleges, increase MBBS seats by 10,000/year
statusReason: 157 new medical colleges established between 2014-2024. MBBS seats increased from 54,348 (2014) to 1,08,940 (2024), exceeding target. Centrally sponsored scheme for colleges in underserved areas implemented.
